required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of GANFORT® UD in Patients With Primary Open Angle Glaucoma (POAG) or Ocular Hypertension (OHT) in a Medical Setting

brief_summary.textblock: The study will evaluate patients diagnosed with POAG or OHT who are switched to GANFORT® UD (unit dose of fixed combination bimatoprost and timolol) therapy for medical reasons in accordance with physician standard clinical practice. All treatment decisions lie with the physician.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Intraocular Pressure (IOP) in the Study Eye
primary_outcome.description: IOP is a measure of the fluid pressure inside the study eye. A result at the Final Visit that is lower than the result at Baseline indicates a reduction in IOP (improvement).

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician Assessment of IOP-Lowering Effect in the Study Eye Using a 3-Point Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The physician assessed the effectiveness of Ganfort® UD with regard to IOP changes from Baseline using a 3-point scale where: 1=Better than expected (best), 2=As expected and 3=Worse than expected. The number of participants in each category is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Assessment of Tolerability on a 4-Point Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The patient assessed the tolerability of Ganfort® UD using a 4-point scale where: 1=very good (best), 2=good, 3=moderate and 4=poor. The number of participants in each category is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician Assessment of Tolerability on a 4-Point Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The physician assessed the patient's tolerability of Ganfort® UD using a 4-point scale where: 1=very good (best), 2=good, 3=moderate and 4=poor. The number of participants in each category is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Discontinued Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who discontinued treatment with Ganfort® UD up to the Week 12 Final Visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Prescribed by the Physician to Continue Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who continued treatment with Ganfort® UD after Week 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician Assessment of Patient Compliance Compared to Previous Treatment on a 3-Point Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The physician assessed patient compliance with Ganfort® UD compared to previous treatment using a 3-point scale where: 1=better (best), 2=equal and 3=worse. The number of participants in each category is reported.

arm_group.description: Patients with POAG or OHT treated with GANFORT® UD (fixed combination bimatoprost and timolol) administered in accordance with physician standard practice for up to 12 weeks.

intervention.description: Patients with POAG or OHT treated with GANFORT® UD (fixed combination bimatoprost and timolol) administered in accordance with physician standard practice for up to 12 weeks.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with primary open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with primary open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension
- Previously prescribed intraocular pressure (IOP)-lowering medication with insufficient IOP control and is now being switched to GANFORT® UD for medical reasons
Exclusion Criteria:

group.title: Patients With POAG or OHT
group.description: Patients with POAG or OHT treated with GANFORT® UD (fixed combination bimatoprost and timolol) administered in accordance with physician standard practice for up to 12 weeks.

group.title: Patients With POAG or OHT
group.description: Patients with POAG or OHT treated with GANFORT® UD (fixed combination bimatoprost and timolol) administered in accordance with physician standard practice for up to 12 weeks.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Intraocular Pressure (IOP) in the Study Eye
outcome.description: IOP is a measure of the fluid pressure inside the study eye. A result at the Final Visit that is lower than the result at Baseline indicates a reduction in IOP (improvement).
outcome.population: Participants from the Per-protocol population, all treated participants who had no major protocol violations, with complete data available at Baseline and Final Visit for analyses.

reported_events.desc: Participating physicians were required to document all serious adverse events (SAEs), irrespective of relationship, and all non‑serious adverse drug reactions (ADRs).

group.title: Patients With POAG or OHT
group.description: Patients with POAG or OHT treated with GANFORT® UD (fixed combination bimatoprost and timolol) administered in accordance with physician standard practice for up to 12 weeks.

event.description: The patient died at the age of 78 years. According to the attending ophthalmologist, no further information regarding cause of death was available. The physician assessed the causal relation between the fatal outcome and Ganfort® UD as ‘unrelated’.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
